skill.name: when-auditing-code-style-use-style-audit
skill.description: Code style and conventions audit with auto-fix capabilities for comprehensive style enforcement
skill.summary: Code style and conventions audit with auto-fix capabilities for comprehensive style enforcement
skill.author: DNYoussef

security_audit.summary: Legitimate code quality tool using standard development tools (ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript). No network calls to suspicious endpoints. Contains shell commands for code linting and formatting which are standard developer tooling. Backup mechanism protects against auto-fix errors.

content.user_title: Audit and Fix Code Style Issues
content.value_statement: Manual code style reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill automates comprehensive style auditing across ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript with auto-fix capabilities that apply 76% of fixes automatically.
actual_capabilities: Scan codebase for ESLint, Prettier, and TypeScript violations
Compare violations against project coding standards
Generate compliance reports in JSON, Markdown, HTML, and CSV
Validate fixes with tests and build verification
limitations: Only supports JavaScript, TypeScript, JSON, CSS, and Markdown files
Some violations require manual review (unused variables, console statements)
Naming convention fixes need reference updates
TypeScript strictness issues mostly require manual intervention

use_cases.title: PR Style Gate
use_cases.description: Enforce code style consistency on every pull request before merge

use_cases.title: Legacy Code Cleanup
use_cases.description: Automatically improve style compliance across large codebases by 30%

use_cases.title: Automated Compliance
use_cases.description: Integrate style validation into CI pipelines with 90% compliance threshold

prompt_templates.title: Quick Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run style-audit to scan for violations and generate a violation report

prompt_templates.title: Auto-Fix Run
prompt_templates.prompt: Use style-audit to scan and auto-fix all ESLint and Prettier violations

prompt_templates.title: Full Compliance
prompt_templates.prompt: Run style-audit with full workflow: scan, compare standards, report, auto-fix, and validate compliance

prompt_templates.title: CI Integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Run style-audit and validate that compliance meets 90% threshold, failing the build if below

output_examples.input: Run style-audit with auto-fix on the current codebase

best_practices: Run style audit on every PR to catch violations early
Apply auto-fixes first, then manually address remaining issues
Set compliance threshold at 90% for pass/fail gates
Keep coding standards documented and version controlled
anti_patterns: Ignoring P0 critical violations (security rules like no-eval)
Running auto-fix without creating a backup first
Skipping test validation after applying fixes

faq.question: What file types does this skill support?
faq.answer: JavaScript, TypeScript, JSX, TSX, JSON, CSS, Markdown, YAML, and SCSS files

faq.question: What is the compliance threshold?
faq.answer: Default threshold is 90%. Fails if compliance drops below this value in CI/CD

faq.question: How does it integrate with CI/CD?
faq.answer: Add npm run style:audit to your pipeline. Check compliance in style-audit-summary.json

faq.question: Is my data safe during auto-fix?
faq.answer: Yes. Creates timestamped backup before fixes. Can rollback with git restore if issues occur

faq.question: What violations require manual fixes?
faq.answer: Unused variables, console statements, variable shadowing, and TypeScript type errors

faq.question: How does this compare to running eslint directly?
faq.answer: Combines ESLint, Prettier, TypeScript checks with standards comparison, auto-fix workflow, and compliance validation
